channel.title: Both hamachi and no-ip dont work for me!
channel.description:
[b]No-Ip problem:[/b] I have a No-ip but I run no-ip duc and it says this:
[Mon 18:54] Checking Remote IP Address. [Mon 18:54] Error connecting to server to check IP address. Will retry in 60 seconds.
[b]Hamachi problem:[/b] I run hamachi and it keeps saying reconnecting... [b]Conclusion:[/b] I have tried for no-ip making a new host and reinstalling DUC it doesnt work, i also tried reinstalling hamachi it didnt work, for hamachi i change around the configuration, it didnt work, please help. ps: yes i have changed my ip and port in the client.

item.title: Both hamachi and no-ip dont work for me!
item.dc:creator: @_ownage1 ~ownage~
item.description:
@_ownage1 wrote:

Try turning off your firewall, I have Norton Internet Security so i right-click on the “picture thing” and click Enable and it should work. It worked for me.

Read full topic
item.source: Both hamachi and no-ip dont work for me!

item.title: Both hamachi and no-ip dont work for me!
item.dc:creator: @Play_N_Skillz Play N Skillz
item.description:
@Play_N_Skillz wrote:

Don’t double post, please.

} back on topic {

I think you should go to your no-ip account at www.no-ip.com ,
click on your no-ip address —> modify, dont modify anything, but scroll down and save it so its updated. Then, try DUC NO-IP again.

Read full topic

item.title: Both hamachi and no-ip dont work for me!
item.dc:creator: @foxfire60 foxfire60
item.description:
@foxfire60 wrote:

well “you haven’t conected right” doesnt really explain stuff, “Perhaps the server is down. maybe it doesn’t like you. maybe your client doesn’t like you. maybe you should not play moparscape. maybe youhave a slow computer.” doesnt explain much either because i have high speed internet AND “you don’t have the right address” doesnt explain much because i do… and this is MY server…i really need help[br][size=1]Posted on: April 16, 2007, 06:57:47 PM[/size][hr]please help?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

problem1: you don’t have the right address.

problem2: you haven’t conected right

problem3: Perhaps the server is down. maybe it doesn’t like you. maybe your client doesn’t like you. maybe you should not play moparscape. maybe youhave a slow computer.
